Class ExModeUlangTlang

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.laple.Exercises.ExModeUlangTlang
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IExerciseMode

    public class ExModeUlangTlang
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExerciseMode
    This class is an implementation of IExerciceMode, it correspond to User Lang TO TeachedLang

    anthonyrey

      Symbol createSymbolFromAnswer(javax.swing.ImageIcon anwser)
      This method returns a Symbol containing only the parameter corresponding to the needed format for answer It is a bit messy, but this helps keeping polymorphism work when using solver.

      • createSymbolFromAnswer

        public Symbol createSymbolFromAnswer(javax.swing.ImageIcon anwser)
        Description copied from interface: IExerciseMode
        This method returns a Symbol containing only the parameter corresponding to the needed format for answer It is a bit messy, but this helps keeping polymorphism work when using solver. Ex : English > Japanese => new Symbol(null, null, answer, null, null, null).
        Specified by:
        createSymbolFromAnswer in interface IExerciseMode
        Parameters:
        anwser - The Image generated from the user drawing
        Returns:
        a Symbol containing the right format of the String only
        See Also:
        Symbol

      • createSymbolFromAnswer

        public Symbol createSymbolFromAnswer(java.lang.String answer)
        Description copied from interface: IExerciseMode
        This method returns a Symbol containing only the parameter corresponding to the needed format for answer It is a bit messy, but this helps keeping polymorphism work when using solver. Ex : English > Japanese => new Symbol(null, answer, null, null, null, null).
        Specified by:

      • getAnswers

        public java.lang.String getAnswers(Symbol answer)
        Description copied from interface: IExerciseMode
        This method returns the given Symbol in the format relative to the one needed for the answer. Ex : English > Japanese => Question : A and Anwser : あ.
        Specified by:
        getAnswers in interface IExerciseMode
        Parameters:
        answer - The symbol corresponding to one of the possible answer in QCM mode
        Returns:
        a String containing the right format of the symbol

      • getQuestion

        public java.lang.String getQuestion(Symbol wantedSymbol)
        Description copied from interface: IExerciseMode
